testCases.explanation: Remove the 2nd node from end (node with value 4), leaving [1,2,3,5]
Single node list, removing the only node yields empty list
Remove last node (value 2) from two-node list
Remove first node (value 1, which is 2nd from end) from two-node list
Remove the head node (value 1, which is 3rd from end)

description: Given the head of a linked list, remove the nth node from the end of the list and return its head.

examples.explanation: The 2nd node from the end is the node with value 4. After removing it, the list becomes [1,2,3,5].
The only node is removed, resulting in an empty list.

constraints: The number of nodes in the list is sz
